title: Can Somebody Please Explain this to Me?
body:
I start off the game tanking Gromp's damage so our TF jungle has a bit of an easier clear. I successfully hook a level 1 Sivir into my Ezreal, exhaust, and that's the first blood. I am the sole help for both dragons that fall, I bait Sivir shields with my hook then flash E on her all game to keep my Ezreal fed, I regularly roam mid between kills and secure picks off there, and I finish the game with literally the BEST POSSIBLE SCORE a support can have, and how do I get rewarded? A freaking B+.

 Someone, please tell me if you know because I am at a loss: what the hell else was I supposed to do?

replies.body:
I'll admit your score is pretty neat, and it looks like you and Ez carried this one hard.

The grading system, from what I've heard, is based on multiple factors:

* KDA
* Wards placed
* Wards destroyed
* Damage dealt
* Damage taken
* Total Farm
* Objectives killed/assisted

Keeping this in mind, I would say you did very well with your KDA, and maybe objectives by your words, but can't say much for the rest.

Edit: and it also compares with other people from your MMR that play the champ.
KDA, CS, Ward placing/destroying, Objectives (towers/inhibs, drag, baron), the skill of the champion played, all of these things are taken into account.
Did you remember to pink ward? Pink wards give a better score than warding constantly with your sightstone.
I bought 1 pink and it was destroyed within 2 minutes FeelsBadMan

I'd consider at least 2-3 pink wards to maintain the score. Even as a mid laner, I refused to leave the lane without a pink ward, unless out of gold.

Also, did you help your team secure other objectives like towers and inhibs? Those two also count to your score, so having at least an assist towards those increase your score.

That's not the only thing the game calculates for a tanky support. There's also the question of how much damage did you soak up, the wards placed etc... Lastly getting an S in short games is typically fairly difficult. I heard the calculations also takes into account the opposing team's champion mastery, but I have yet to see confirmation of that.

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2172504643/204643871?tab=stats

Ok, so I admittedly could have soaked more damage I guess? Wards placed is nearly 1/minute though. Also Ezreal got an S-, and, no offense intended, but I do doubt that the way to earn an S is to stand in the way of more skillshots (which is the major source of damage from the enemy botlane)

Not standing in front of damage by the AD took nearly as much as you did. Also your participation for your team's kills was less than 50%. I understand it's hard to participate in more of them which is why quick games are harder to get a higher grade in. Also there is a level of difficulty associated with champions so Blitz pulls may just not be seen as the most difficult mechanic to pull off.

Yeah, plus there were a few kills where I was surprised that I didn't get an assist on them, like when there was a 4-man gank bot and I successfully saved both mine and Ezreal's lives by ulting on at least 3 of them and Ez killed the 4th whom I guess didn't get hit by my ult even though it looked like she did. 

Thanks for your help, by the way, I really appreciate it :)

A lot of people play Blitz support. It bases the grades off of how well he is played by everyone.

There are also other parts that determine the grade, like warding and objectives
I didn't know it went by how well he's played by others. Would that mean in theory Urgot and Nunu would be the easiest champs to earn S's on since their playrates are so low?

while higher grades might be easier, getting something like an S+ will be much harder, as the people playing the champions are die hard mains that know the champ inside and out.

Playing a champ in an off-meta position is a bit easier though. For instance, Dyrus recently posted a video of him playing tank Nami top, and he didn't do the greatest, but still got an S- because *nobody* plays Nami top
hmm... so what you're saying is I should play Blitz jungle? {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

It compares your score to the average score of everyone playing that champ in that position. So, while very few people play Nunu and Urgot, the ones that do likely main the champion and are quite proficient - making it just as hard to get S-ranks :P

If the team has 21 kills and you ave 10 assists, then you helped with only half of your team's kills. I don't know how that weighs in to the Mastery ratings, but you might try roaming more post lane phase to assist as many allies as possible.

my last game on this account got me the S and it's no where near this... Taric 4/6/29   kill participation 59% ... I get the S often... (not recently since my epic lose streak happened)  But I found that having half or more kill participation ( I don't roam often at all)  gets you a good grade. This game might be too short for it. If you had 2 kills even you probably would have the S. My most common S happens on Nami and Taric apparently. I never have any chests available anymore. and like 4 keys XD
Well you had no kills and no cs. So of course you did bad (or so the game thinks).
